node.title: Rapid antigen tests for COVID are being used at Christmas lunches across Australia. Should they be free?
node.alt: A close-up view of a white plastic rapid antigen test for COVID-19 held by hands in blue surgical gloves.
node.description: As COVID-19 cases rise across Australia and the threat of the Omicron variant looms over Christmas celebrations scheduled for the days ahead, some believe making rapid antigen tests free would help curb rising infections.
node.content:
["As COVID-19 cases rise across Australia, health authorities have made it clear they expect the Omicron variant to overtake\u00a0Delta.", "To reduce the spread of infection\u00a0as experts work quickly to understand the new variant,\u00a0people are\u00a0being urged\u00a0to make use of rapid antigen tests.", "But unlike the many millions of PCR (polymerase chain reaction) tests that people have been able to access free in Australia throughout the pandemic, rapid antigen tests cost upwards of $10 each.", "They have been available\u00a0over the counter in some chemists and supermarkets since November, and cost about $30 for a pack of two or $50 for a pack of five.", "There are concerns that the cost is too\u00a0much for some people, particularly when multiple tests are needed, and some are calling for them to be made free to encourage greater uptake.", "
What are rapid\u00a0antigen tests?
", "Use of rapid antigen tests has been a relatively new thing in Australia compared with other parts of the world.", "The tests are not quite as reliable as the PCR tests that have been a mainstay of the COVID-19 pandemic in Australia, but they do provide a faster result.", "They detect COVID-19\u00a0by reacting to\u00a0proteins on the surface of the virus called antigens, and they rely on swabs from the nose and throat.", "The at-home tests typically use\u00a0those\u00a0swabs mixed with liquid on a paper strip to return a result in about 20 to 30\u00a0minutes.", "If you record a positive\u00a0result, you need to follow up with a PCR test and isolate until you receive that\u00a0result.", "So far, the TGA has approved nine different tests for home use.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
", "
How are they being used?
", "As cases of COVID have increased with the loosening of restrictions, and as concerns about the Omicron variant grow, more heath authorities have begun advising people to use rapid antigen tests to help curb infections.", "The Victorian government has urged\u00a0anyone who is not displaying symptoms to take a rapid antigen test before heading to Christmas gatherings to help reduce the risk of COVID spreading. The NSW government has issued similar\u00a0advice.", "In some vulnerable settings, such as aged care, rapid antigen tests have already\u00a0been supplied by the federal government for a few months to ensure all visitors return a negative test before entering a facility.", "The tests have been supplied to facilities in areas considered high risk.", "Across Australia, many industries and businesses have been purchasing and supplying the tests to workers to help reduce the risk of spread.", "Some families of those vulnerable to COVID, such as elderly people or those with a disability, have set up their own testing routines to try to keep their loved ones safe.", "There are some instances where those exposed to COVID are able to access free rapid antigen tests, but as a general rule, the tests are not covered and people need to pay for the tests themselves.", "
What's the argument for making them free?
", "Curtin University public health expert Jaya Dantas said making the tests free or low cost would help curb the spread of COVID-19.", "", "
Public health expert Jaya Dantas says making rapid antigen tests cheaper, or free, would encourage far more people to start using them.(ABC News: Herlyn Kaur)
", "Professor Dantas said until recently, cases had remained low in Australia, so as cases grow, the country needs to learn from examples overseas where case numbers have been much higher.", "\"These tests have been used in many parts of Europe,\" she said.", "\"In the Netherlands they have been free since the European summer.", "\"In the UK they were initially at a small cost, but now because of the increase of cases they are being made free.\"", "", "
Rapid antigen tests only became available for purchase in supermarkets and chemists in November.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "The Australian Council of Trade Unions secretary Liam O'Brien\u00a0called for rapid antigen tests to be made free for all workers, particularly those at small- and medium-sized businesses.", "He said\u00a0an effective rapid testing program would involve testing staff multiple times a week to make sure they are not carrying the infection.", "\"If you're going to start doing that, it becomes extremely expensive for small business,\" he said.", "\"The cost [shouldn't be]\u00a0borne on a worker, we've got to make sure that these are free and accessible for the whole community.\"", "Mr O'Brien said the cost of subsidising the tests would far outweigh the cost COVID exposures have on individual businesses and wider industries.", "\"I'm sure many Australians are sitting at home right now, especially in places like Sydney where cases are rising, in fear not just of potentially catching COVID in their workplace ... but continuing to have exposures that then cause them to have to go and test and isolate,\" he said.", "", "
COVID exposures are still causing disruptions to many workplaces across the country.(ABC News: Che Chorley)
", "
What might happen next?
", "A federal Department of Health spokesperson said it was in the process of working with the Australian Health Protection Principal Committee to \"develop a nationally consistent framework for the use of RAT (rapid antigen tests)\".", "\"The department is also consulting with a range of stakeholders, both within government and industry, to identify where support for RAT is of most benefit, particularly in specific use cases and settings of national interest,\" they said.", "\"These consultations will inform the Australian government's considerations on where to provide additional targeted support to help Australia reopen and provide the confidence Australians are looking for as we adjust to living with COVID-19.\"", "Professor Dantas said if rapid antigen tests were made much cheaper, or free, there may be a problem with supply.", "\"At this stage, I don't think that would be a problem,\" she said.", "She said if there were\u00a0enough tests available to roll them out more widely, they could serve as a \"mitigating strategy\" against the current wave of infections.", "Both major supermarket chains, Coles and Woolworths, acknowledged\u00a0demand for the tests has been increasing, but they said supply was good.", "Woolworths has purchasing limits in place, with customers only able to buy 10 tests at a time, and they are kept behind the service desk rather than out on shelves.", "\"We're seeing elevated demand for rapid antigen testing kits, particularly in NSW,\" a spokesperson said.", "\"We have stock available in our store network, but there are places where we have sold out.\"", "The spokesperson said availability of the tests was expected to improve in the coming days.", "Mr O'Brien\u00a0said the federal government should stockpile the tests and ensure they're available across the population.", "\"We'll stockpile them and make sure we're distributing them to areas of need,\u00a0where we're getting these high rates of community transmission, like what we're seeing in Sydney at the moment.\"", "", "
What the experts know about the Omicron variant so far(Norman Swan)
"]
